subject: RE: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods
msgSnippet: Can t break!!?? You never make typos and return the wrong variable in a getter, or set the wrong variable in a setter? If so, you re a better coder than me :)

	Can't break!!?? You never make typos and return the wrong variable
in a getter, or set the wrong variable in a setter? If so, you're a better
coder than me :)

-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 02, 2002 1:04 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods


Quoting raju99 <theindiandude@...>:

> Hi,
> 
> I am trying to answer the following question for myself -
> "What is the best approach for testing get/set methods ?"

One answer: do not test what cannot possibly break. If you really want a
get() 
and set() method, and most of the time they're built for no good reason,
then 
just code them. Unless they're doing something more than answering the value
of 
a field, they can't break.

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.
